utterance.speaker: DARREN IVES
utterance.content: She’s texting me again, bro.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL KIRBY
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Angie.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL
utterance.content: You going to see her again?

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Nah man, I have to shut that down.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL
utterance.content: You’ve been singing the blues about this woman for months. She reaches her hand out and you’re going to slap it away?

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Yeah, well, she broke my heart, man.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL
utterance.content: Which means she deserves another shot. Trust me, I know. Fourteen years and counting.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: You’re right. I’ll give her a call.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL
utterance.content: I’ll go get the rest of the bags.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: That wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Says the guy with the razor sharp French toast and the sausage kabob.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that was m,e but that balloon had it coming. To you, my love, my heart, my bride. Welcome back to our home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, that is so sweet, Castle. But how is this a welcome back if I’ve been sneaking into your room almost every night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, because you officially moved all your stuff back in. Now that we’ve agreed to hunt LokSat together we can simply pick up where we left off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And as I recall we left off this morning somewhere right about here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lucy, music off.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: As you wish, Rick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I integrated Lucy into all the loft’s infrastructure. Climate, lights, music, you name it, she controls it. Just got to work out a few kinks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I still like a few things the old fashioned way, so do you want me to make you a cup of coffee?

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Uh, no need, Kate. I’ve programmed Rick’s coffee exactly to his liking. Cuban blend, two sugars, pinch of nutmeg.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s amazing, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: No, Rick, you’re amazing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you are.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: No, you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Lucy, you are.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Rick, you are amazing and you know it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stop it! I’m not doing this with you again.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: You stop it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Got it. We have a homicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You, me, and a crime scene. Just as nature intended. All right, Captain, let’s roll.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, no can do. Captains have to multi-task. In fact, I am due for a meeting with the DA so … why don’t you meet up with the boys? We can debrief later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … Lucy, do you think you could make me a cup of coffee? Splash of low fat milk, two Splendas?

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: No can do. All out of Splenda, but there is a Starbuck's two blocks from here. Would you like directions?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Thanks. I know where it is.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Great. Have fun. Goodbye. Leave the house.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Look who’s here.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Castle! So happy you and Beckett are back together. Now do us all a favor and don’t mess things up with her again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why do you assume it was my fault?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Everything is your fault. Now, come meet our new victim. Michael Kirby, single GSW. Our thief-slash-killer rappelled from that AC duct.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And they got away with a hundred thousand dollars in cash.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: This is Darren Ives. He was inside when he heard the shot. Rushed out but the killer was already gone.

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: I don’t know how that guy did it. I mean, this is a high security warehouse. It’s damn near Fort Knox.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you didn’t see anything suspicious?

utterance.speaker: DARREN
utterance.content: Nothing. It was just a normal drop.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s finish taking your statement over here, please.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What, are your allergies acting up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this, gelatin? It smells like ladies’ perfume. What is that scent? Is it White Diamonds? No, Chanel No. 5. Ah. One Direction body spray. Nailed it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That stuff dripped from the AC vent.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: CSU took samples. It’s from the alarm sensors in the vent. Apparently the killer used it to disable the security system.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie, can you ask the lab to put a rush on this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? What is it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ve seen this MO before.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was like, ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, when you worked with the Fifty-Fourth?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I collared a thief. Name was uh … Sonia Ruiz. She was part of a crew that stole ten million dollars’ worth of gold coins from an auction house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And they used a fragrant gel, too?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was actually a unique blend of Jell-O and ladies’ perfume.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re saying a kid’s dessert mixed with eau de toilette can foil a sophisticated security system? I’m telling you, we need a dog.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does that formula even work?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, someone in the crew came up with it. The gelatin blocks the security lasers and the phalates in the perfume creates an even distribution over the sensors. But the mix has to be exact. Eighty percent Jell-O, twenty percent perfume.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which is the precise ratio of the gelatin found at our crime scene. Lab sent over the analysis report identical to the heist from nine years ago where the only perp captured was Sonia Ruiz.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep, that’s her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So obviously this wasn’t a coincidence. Most likely someone from the crew reused the technique and is behind our victim’s murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, it couldn’t have been Sonia. She got fifteen years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the rest of the crew.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, she didn’t give up any names. The rumor was that the crew was put together by some mysterious shot caller who goes by the street name of Great White.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is it possible to trace them through the stolen gold coins? I mean, they had to have tried to sell them at some point.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There hasn’t been any trace of them since the heist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that makes sense. If they melted the coins down for the gold that would render the coins untraceable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, why don’t we pay Sonia Ruiz a little visit? She might not have turned on her crew back in the day but after nine years hard time we might be able to persuade her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what, from what I remember she may be the type to hold a grudge so … you might have better luck taking Castle with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh – – not falling for that trick again. Contrary to what you three lead me to believe, those women’s prisons are nothing like the late night Skinamax movies, so … have fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Miss Ruiz, tell me what you know.

utterance.speaker: SONIA RUIZ
utterance.content: Please. I didn’t snitch back in the day. Why would I start now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because nine years ago this was just a burglary and now it’s a murder.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Murder? Who died?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: An armored truck driver. Look, Sonia, you help me out, I’ll help you out.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: With what? I’m up for parole in three months and due to overcrowding I’m a lock to get out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if I go to your parole hearing and testify that you refused to cooperate in solving a homicide.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: It’s like that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I got an innocent man in the morgue who left behind a wife and two small kids so yeah, it’s like that.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: I couldn’t help you even if I wanted to. The gold coin heist Great White set up was a two person job. But I don’t know my partner’s name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: And yet it’s true. He didn’t know my name and I didn’t know his, so neither one of us could rat out the other. We used shark names. I was Mako, he was Hammerhead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, what can you tell me about Great White.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Now, his name I knew. Jimmy Sanchez. He was a neighborhood shot caller back in the day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. So where can I find him?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: In the cemetery. He died a little over three years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, if Great White is dead then Hammerhead’s most likely our killer.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Hey, that Jell-O perfume formula was his invention so it has to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you remember about Hammerhead?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Um …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything. At all.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Once he let it slip that he met Jimmy Sanchez at a bar called um … El Toro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. I’ll have my detectives head off over there.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Ooh. Good luck with that, lady. It’s up in Spanish Harlem. No one there talks to the police. However, they will talk to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want me to put you on the street? No.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Hey. You’re hanging parole over my head. You want Hammerhead? This is how you get him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The department of corrections authorized her for an out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Right now Sonia is our best and only path to Hammerhead’s real identity.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what’s the plan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and Espo are going to head over to the – – excuse me, what’s going on? What are you not telling me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So uh … funny story, really. Sonia and I, we were kind of … involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Involved, like dating?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dating? No. Come on. Not dating. We were more like engaged.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Engaged? You were – wait a second, all these years you never told me that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You never asked.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re a cop. How could you get involved with a criminal?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, technically, they were in the same line of work, so really it’s a … workplace romance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thank you. I didn’t know she was a crook at first, okay? I – I met her at a club. She seemed normal. We just – we just clicked. And it’s probably why she hid who she really was from me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when did you find out the truth?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: After it was too late! We were engaged and she started acting strange. Disappearing at odd hours, and she couldn’t look me in the eye. And then news of that gold coin heist broke and I – I don’t know. I knew. And I was the one who arrested her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So did you ask for the ring back or did you let her keep that so she could trade it for cigarettes in the prison yard? That’s – don’t answer that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so obviously you’re sitting this one out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa – why’re you benching me? Okay, I get it. Look, there’s no need. Any feelings I had for her died the moment I slapped those cuffs on. Trust me, I am over her completely.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Javier?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You sure you’re over her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You might want to tell your mouth. Close that up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s a’ight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you okay? You seemed a little taken aback when you first saw her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No man, it’s just, um … it’s just a little déjà vu. She’s literally wearing the same outfit I arrested her in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nine years later it’s still a great dress.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was a Friday night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was a Friday night. We went salsa dancing on Friday nights.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Javier, there’s no shame in admitting if you still have feelings.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I know! But I don’t. She’s just another convict. Nothing else.

utterance.speaker: CORRECTIONS OFFICER
utterance.content: This ankle monitor is a next generation device with a variety of new tracking features. Here’s the instruction manual. Now, I’m going to walk you through some of the features, but –

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: What does he have to do with this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Detective Ryan’s going to accompany you to the bar. He’s –

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: What, him? Hell no! Take me back to prison. This is not going to work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, I’m sorry. What’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You’re going to send me into a Spanish Harlem bar with Saint Patty on my arm?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sweetheart, I used to work undercover. I can take care of myself.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Look, the only way this is going to work is if I go in with somebody who can blend in. Someone like Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: For the umpteenth time, Beckett, I can handle this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Because if it was me I don’t think I would be that confident.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is it awkward? Of course. But it’s the only way we’re going to solve this murder. Castle and Ryan are going to be backing me up in a follow car. What’s the worst that can happen?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. And that’s what makes me nervous.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kate. I am not going to let you down.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, listen up, Sonia. You do what I say, when I say it. Understand?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Nice to see you too, sweetie. Oh, muy es cosita -

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is not a joke, okay? When I say jump, you say –

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: That you’re out of your damn mind if you think I’m jumping in these heels, okay? And speaking of, I need new clothes because this outfit is damn near ten years old. And I got a rep to protect so I need labels.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Fine, whatever. Let’s just hurry up and get this over with.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Didn’t I used to say that to you whenever you got frisky at night?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is going to be so much fun.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Can you please speed up? You know, my prison term is going to be over by the time we get there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m going the speed limit.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Oh, good. You know, I wouldn’t want you to be pulled over by a cop. Come on! Hurry up!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m going to slow down a little bit. There we go. That’s much better.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I still can’t believe Javi was engaged to that woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can. I mean, you see the electricity between those two? It crackles.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it might be a problem. We need to keep an eye on her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well actually, I think we can do more than that. There’s a listening device built into Sonia’s ankle monitor.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A hidden mic?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. All we have to do is enter the security number into the app. We can hear everything they’re saying.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But they wouldn’t know that we’re listening. That would be an invasion of their privacy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got a problem with that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. No.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You know, I’m glad you didn’t get fat over all that guilt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What guilt?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: For turning me in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would I feel guilty about doing my job?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Because you love me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Loved you. Past tense. Way past. Done. Finished. Terminado.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You know, I was meaning to say thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: For arresting me. You saved me the misery of spending another day with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oooh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s harsh.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: How is your abuelita’s hip?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good. She finally got it replaced.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Oh, good. She was always so sweet. Your whole family was. That’s what haunts me, you know? Thinking how they must have reacted when they learned I was nothing more than a crook.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Great White met Hammerhead here. It stands to reason someone here knows his real identity.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Yeah, but that was nine years ago. Where do we start?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: The bartender. He’s bound to know where the old timers are, yeah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me do the talking.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: What’s going on, guys? What can I get for you?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Uh, shots of tequila. Double rose.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Double rose coming up.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Thank you, baby.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What is she doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s blending into her environment. It’s actually a brilliant strategy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Either that, or getting Javier drunk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would she want to do that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Exactly. Exactly.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Ding ding. We got a winner.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Set us up again.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: If you say so.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey bro, how long have you been bartending here?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: A little over ten years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, so then you remember a guy named Jimmy Sanchez? Went by the name of, uh Great White?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Great White. Yeah, yeah, why you ask?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Did you ever see him with a good looking kid from the neighborhood? Short, with a beard?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: No. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Hey, it’s all good. I just got on parole, you know, from a little job we did back in the day. So if I could just find him …

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Look, señorita, I can’t help you out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How about now?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing, bro?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Give me his name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Does it sound like –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like he’s playing five finger filet with the bartender? It certainly does.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t tell Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t tell Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ooh. My hand’s getting twitchy, bro. You better tell me something.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Okay. Look, it’s Joey. His name’s Joey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Joey what?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Beats the hell out of me, man! I haven’t seen the guy in over a year. That’s all I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t believe you.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Stop! He’s close with his grandma, she lives up the street. Third building, brick one. 6D. She can tell you where he is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: 6D. 6D. It’s open.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I lost the signal.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Make a move and I’ll kill you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Who are you and why’d you break into my Gigi’s house?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Put the gun down.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Screw that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Normally I’d do this back and forth thing with you but I’ve got to go chase her, so –

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Man!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t go anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, here we go. Just reenter the serial number and voila.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: They’re my toes and I can pick ‘em if I want.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the wrong ankle monitor. I transposed the numbers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was that -?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damn it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s right there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I got her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sonia, stop!

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Javi, you’re okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m okay, What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: There was the guy with the shotgun, and –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let me see your hands!

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: What – what, you think I was trying to escape? I see a gun and I run. I was trying to get to a phone to call 911.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not buying it, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Irish, I got three months left on my sentence, okay? I already served nine long years. I run right now, they add another two. How dumb do you think I am?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t answer that. It’s a trap, trust me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think she’s telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s not like she hasn’t lied to me before.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Damn. I knew you weren’t over me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I am so over you. Now, was that Hammerhead that jumped me with a shotgun?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Yeah. That was him.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Look, I didn’t know you were a cop, man. You broke into my Gigi’s apartment. My shotgun is registered and I have a right to defend my property. See, you got nothing to hold me on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You like sharks, Joey?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re cool, I guess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s your favorite shark?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I like the ones with the funny shaped heads, you know what I’m talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah, the hammerheads.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s it. That’s funny, because we heard that you – – were Hammerhead.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah? Who told you that? Wait, that girl that was with you earlier. I knew she looked familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hammerheads aren’t usually man killers, Joey, so what happened?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ooh. I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ten years ago you were part of a heist crew that used gelatin mixed with perfume to disable security systems. Last night you used the same recipe to break into a high security warehouse. Only thing is, you got caught and you murdered a guard.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Last night I was in Jersey. At my Chicken, Chicken, Chicken. It’s a chicken restaurant. I own seven in the tristate area.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me guess, you bought those with your share of the gold coin heist?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Even if I did, the statute of limitations is over. And I have a dozen witnesses that put me at the Chicken, Chicken, Chicken until 3AM so you ain’t going to touch me with this score, either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t mean you weren’t a part of the heist. How else would they know about the gelatin formula?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Easy. I ain’t the only one who knew it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great White? Jimmy Sanchez is dead. We confirmed that.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, but he ran other crews. Ain’t no telling on how many of them he told. Look, I’m a successful businessman now. All right? Whatever criminal instincts I had … long gone. I’m all about the chicken now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Cap. Joey’s alibi checks out. We’re pulling apart his financials, but it looks like he might be telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ve got unis taking Sonia back to prison. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just, uh … you know. I’m just bummed it didn’t work out. Not between me and Sonia, I’m talking about the case. Ryan! You got something?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. I think that crew used an inside man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? What makes you think that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The security system at that high security warehouse is way more sophisticated than the auction house where those gold coins were stolen. I mean, they had an infrared camera system that some low-tech bypass couldn’t have knocked out, yet it was down at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So … somebody on the inside did turn it off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes. Michael Kirby. Our victim. His security code was the one used.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But if he was in on it then why kill him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But we could ask his wife.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Captain, I’d like to volunteer to take Sonia back to the prison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I don’t think that’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, but it’s the right thing to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. You interview Kirby’s wife. And I expect you back first thing in the morning ready to work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll take her, boys. Captain’s orders.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: This is bull, Javi. You know I can still help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Joey was your only shot.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: This sucks. I thought I’d at least get a decent meal. Maybe a hot shower. Sleep in a real bed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, in three months you’ll get all that.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You don’t understand. Nine years I’ve eaten prison food. Slept on a six inch piece of foam. Nine years I’ve had to live on edge. And I thought I’d get a little time to relax.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the drive is an hour. You can relax in the car.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mrs. Kirby, we know about your husband’s involvement in the heist.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found anonymous bank deposits totaling ten thousand dollars made to your joint account. We can charge you as an accessory.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was this man’s name? What did he look like?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is the phone still there?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: What are we doing? This is your mom’s house.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s Thursday. Family dinner night. You can have a home cooked meal and then it’s straight back to the prison.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: I can’t face your family, Javi. Not after what they know about me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I didn’t tell them anything.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I told them that I was the one who screwed up. That you broke up with me.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You did that for me? Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: MAMA
utterance.content: You’re late. You know how I worry. How hard is it to call?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just traffic. Come here, come here.

utterance.speaker: MAMA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Buenos noches, abuelita.

utterance.speaker: TITO
utterance.content: What’s up, cuz? Still standing up to the man?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Still living in your mama’s basement?

utterance.speaker: TITO
utterance.content: Yeah, whatever.

utterance.speaker: MAMA
utterance.content: Sonia? Is that you?

utterance.speaker: MAMA
utterance.content: So are you two back together?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. No, we are not together.

utterance.speaker: ABUELITA
utterance.content: Muy estupido! Don’t let this one get away twice.

utterance.speaker: MAMA
utterance.content: Come. Eat. I made Javier’s favorite, mofongo.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You’re a lucky man, Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And why’s that?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Your family. You know, I really never had one. My dad left when I was five and my mom had two jobs just to keep the lights on. I have a lot of regrets, Javi. Bad choices, compromises I made, the path I took. If things would have been different we would have had a family of our own by now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: It would have been good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I better get you back.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Can I at least take that hot shower? Please?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ten minutes, okay? Then we’ve got to hit the road.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You can join me if you want.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t – I don’t think that would be a good idea.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: I’ll leave the door unlocked. Just in case you change your mind.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Christ - hey, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi, listen to me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our victim was the inside man. He communicated with the killer using a burner cell. I pulled the records from the killer’s phone. I traced the calls it made. There were three made to Sonia’s prison.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What – what are you saying?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sonia was in on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t believe I was so stupid. She played me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, she sure did, buddy.

utterance.speaker: MAMA
utterance.content: Kevin, I fixed you your own plate.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Gracias, Mama.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, it’s your mom’s mofongo. The whole world could be ending. I’d still be chowing down.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait. Where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, she doesn’t know. Because if she did you’d be in deep trouble. So we’re going to track your girl down before our Captain finds out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, I – I can’t ask you to do that for me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You don’t have to. I’m volunteering. All right? So let’s turn your brain back on. If Sonia was communicating with the killer, then she orchestrated this whole armored car heist to look exactly like the one she went to prison for, knowing that we’d go to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then Sonia would get out, lead us to Joey, who pulled a gun so she could run away. The whole thing was an escape plan that she set up with Joey beforehand.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Unfortunately for Sonia we ran her down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Assuming all this is true, why now? I mean, she had three months left until parole. Why throw that all away?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. But I bet you Joey does.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We pulled your financials, Joey. You know, it turns out that Chicken, Chicken, Chicken is bankrupt, bankrupt, bankrupt.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Look, I’m doing some corporate restructuring, all right? That’s no crime.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We also found a pair of phone calls to your phone from the same burner phone that called our victim. Now, that makes you an accessory to murder.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Okay! I got a phone call from a guy that I never met. Said he knew I was in trouble and he offered to bail me out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How much would that take?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Half a million.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They didn’t get a fraction of that from the bank job. Sonia’s share of the gold. We never found it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe that’s why she broke out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But again, why now? The money would still be there in three months.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Play time's over, Joey. You better tell us who this guy is or you’re going to be living in an eight foot cell until they carry you out in a six foot box.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I swear, I’m telling the truth! All right? All I know is that he was an ex-boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know any of Sonia’s ex-boyfriends. Why don’t you see if you can ID any of them? Meanwhile I’ll pull visitor logs from the prison.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, how’s it going?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fine. Just running down leads.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh, and how’s Javi holding up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he’s been better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know what? I’ll bring some cronuts by in the morning. That usually cheers him up. Okay. I’ll talk to you soon. Bye.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Everything all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. I hope so.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: This will make it better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I have to say, Katherine, it is so good to have you home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: I second that motion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lucy, what the hell. Turn it off.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Whoa, language, Kate. Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, really? Well then, let me make it up to you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Isn’t that a little extreme?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No, actually, I don’t think so. Look, this might sound odd but ever since I got back I feel like Lucy’s been jealous.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She’s an it. A CPU wrapped in a plastic pyramid. She doesn’t have emotions. And she certainly can’t be jealous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were saying?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So – so you’re telling me she’s only had one visitor in the last year? All right, what’s the name? Alberto Pena. All right, thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa. You’re an old ass boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. You’re Sonia’s father.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Jenkins. Have you seen Esposito?

utterance.speaker: JENKINS
utterance.content: Yeah. He ran out of here ten minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t let you put yourself out there for me anymore, bro. This is my mess and I’ve got to clean it up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, everybody, stop! I need to know what Esposito found out when he ran out of here. Please. It’s a matter of life and death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sonia! Get away from the bed.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: My dad, he’s dying. I’m sorry I didn’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just stop it. I’m not buying any of it. You didn’t break out of prison just because your old man was kicking the bucket. He has your share of the gold. When you found out he had a stroke you panicked. Because you were worried his new wife was going to steal your gold. The thing I don’t get is, why didn’t you just have your partner on the outside get it for you? You don’t know where it is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jimmy Sanchez wasn’t Great White. Your father is. And he kept your share of the gold after you went in.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Ah, Javi. You were always too smart for your own good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t believe the two of you kept me in the dark about this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain, I’m sorry –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. We will talk about this later. Right now let’s just focus on Espo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just hope it’s not too late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Sonia and her partner wanted to kill Esposito they wouldn’t have done it here. No, they must need him for something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Question is, why was Sonia so desperate to see her father before he died? According to Espo they weren’t even that close.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he has something she wanted. And I think I know what it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gold. He was holding her cut of the heist from nine years ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sonia didn’t want the secret of the gold location to die with her father.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They took Esposito for insurance in case we tried to stop them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means we find Pena’s coin stash, we’ll find Espo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Problem is we don’t know the first thing about this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, time for a crash course. Let’s tear this place apart.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Javi, you awake? How’s your head?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m fine. Your boy toy hits like a little b*tch.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You know, I’m sorry, Javi. It wasn’t supposed to go like this. No one was meant to get hurt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Forget hurt. Two little kids don’t have a dad today because of you and your boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You don’t think that’s not tearing me up? You have to believe me, Javi. I didn’t know Ronaldo was going to kill that man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That is such a copout. You knew what he was capable of. I just didn’t think that you were. I thought that deep down you had a good heart. I know that you had a tough go when you were little but sooner or later you’ve gotta stop blaming your childhood. At some point when you choose wrong over right … that’s on you.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: It’s always been so black and white with you, huh? Espo’s rules of life. Let me tell you something. I spent nine years in that cell while Joey and my dad breathed free air and spent their millions. All I had to hold onto was the money. No way in hell was I going to let that go.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: This is it up ahead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well. I hope that money’s worth it. Because you’re going to have to live with what you’ve done for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: You really should be nicer to the lady. Not that her little soft spot’s going to save you, because once we get that gold –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sonia’s dad owned at least half a dozen businesses. Dry cleaners, a car wash, a Cuban restaurant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All high cash flow. Makes sense if he was selling off his gold bit by bit. He’d need a place to launder the money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, according to the company’s bank records, its weekly receipts were pretty uniform.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except look at this. The dry cleaners’. About three months ago there was a spike in the deposit amount, and three months before that, and before that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same with the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he was retrieving some of the gold every three months, selling it off, and then running the proceeds through his businesses.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan? Where is Vikram with the GPS info from Pena’s phone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He just sent this over. Pena stayed close to home most of the time. Except for this location. It looks to be an outlier. He wouldn’t go there often, only once every –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Every three months?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Exactly. And only at night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what’s there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s see … uh … it’s an old ConEd storage facility. Perfect for stashing coins.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pena owned a transport company that subcontracts with ConEd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then that’s it. That’s where he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go. Once they find the gold they’re going to make a run for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After they kill Espo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You guys should just turn yourselves in. Even if you do get away with the gold there’s nowhere that you can go where my guys won’t find you.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: Well, maybe. But I like my odds a lot more than yours right now.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: She said it would be up there.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: You go up. I’ll stay here with him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Careful, baby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow. Haven’t seen you smile like that since I gave you the ring.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Seems so long ago, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: It was a different life.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: We can’t carry the gold and watch him at the same time, so this is where his story ends.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: Come on, babe. Don’t even pretend like you didn’t know it was going to go down this way. Turn away if you don’t want to see it.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: I can’t let you do that.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: We don’t have time for this. He’s got to die and we’ve got to go.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: No. We leave him here. Alive.

utterance.speaker: RONALDO
utterance.content: He was your fiancé and he threw you away. He left you to rot in prison. I was the one who was there for you. So why’re you willing to shoot me to save him?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Because I love him.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Javi. Javi! Javi!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s over, Sonia.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: No. I won’t go back. I can’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You can.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you will. Nine years ago I found out you were a thief. You know what I did then?

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Yeah. You arrested me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. I went home and I packed a bag. And then I grabbed my passport, cleared out my savings account. I was ready to abandon everything I believed in because I couldn’t picture a life without you.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Why didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m a cop, Sonia. I – it’s all I ever wanted to be. If I threw that away then I wouldn’t even deserve you.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: We got a second chance, Javi. We can run now. It can be like it was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. It can never be like it was. If I was strong enough to walk up those steps and arrest the love of my life then you are strong enough to face what comes next.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You okay, partner?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I screwed up. I let my feelings for Sonia cloud my judgment and I let my guard down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I’m not going to pretend that I haven’t done the same thing, but I am a captain now so I have to suspend you for a week. No pay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes ma’am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You did the right thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you give us a sec?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So uh, I talked to the DA. And when the dust settled he’s willing to let you plead out as an accessory if you testify against Ronaldo.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: How many more years?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At least two.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Are you going to come visit me this time?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Are you going to bring me a cake with a file in it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Probably not.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: Thank God you didn’t go bald.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was just thinking the same thing about you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Take care of yourself, Sonia.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll see you soon.

utterance.speaker: SONIA
utterance.content: I hope so.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So .. what are you going to do now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. Turns out I’ve got the rest of the day free.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, me too. I uh … just called in sick. Let’s go get really drunk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn straight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Home at last. With all the makings of a perfect evening. Thai food, a bottle of Pinot, and my two favorite ladies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, two? Is that a joke about my boobs?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m referring, of course, to you and Lucy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Right. Lucy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Don’t be mad. I’m kidding. Is - is it too late to say it’s about your boobs?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s – it’s fine. The truth is, is that I overreacted the other day. I have a feeling that Lucy and I going to be on much better terms from here on out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I am glad to hear it. You hear that, Lucy? I knew you’d win her over. Now, why don’t you dim the lights for us just a little bit?

utterance.speaker: LINUS
utterance.content: How’s that, Rick? Are the lights not to your satisfaction?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, they’re fine. Just, uh … who are you and where’s Lucy?

utterance.speaker: LINUS
utterance.content: My name’s Linus. And I’m starting to think you don’t like me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Very funny. What did you do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I read the user’s manual, and apparently with a simple flick of a switch she can become a he.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You killed Lucy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I didn’t kill her. I mean, she’s still in there. Why? You want her back?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Of course not. No. No, Linus it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, good. Well, I’m going to go change, so why don’t you guys become acquainted?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, Linus, let’s get this bromance started. How about you make me a little cappuccino?

utterance.speaker: LINUS
utterance.content: It’s a little late for caffeine, Rick. How about some relaxing yoga stretches before bed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And experiment’s over. Where’s that switch? Ow! Linus, you gave me a little shock. I think you must have a short or something.

utterance.speaker: LINUS
utterance.content: I don’t like to be touched, Rick. Not by you anyway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett! Beckett!
